content:
• Monday, December 29, 2014
  • VER

    American Realty surges as activist discloses stake

    • Keith Meister's Corvex Management discloses a stake of nearly 65M shares, or 7.1% of troubled American Realty Capital (ARCP).
    • "It is clear to the Reporting Persons that this is a time of transition and a unique opportunity for a ‘new start’ for the company and its shareholders," says Corvex in the 13D, also disclosing it's had discussions with ARCP management.
    • Corvex most recently was behind the overthrow of the board and management at Commonwealth REIT (now renamed Equity Commonwealth).
    • Shares +6.1% after hours, following a 2.2% gain in the regular session.
    • "The ARCP Board of Directors is pleased that Corvex shares its belief that ARCP is an attractive investment," says the company, commenting on the Corvex filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM | 69 Comments

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AREX +7.1%. ECR +7.1%. CDE +5.0%. EPE +3.9%. ECYT +3.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: OSGB -5.5%. RNET -5.1%. MDU -3.4%. GTI -3.2%. REXX -3.02%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVEO

    Civeo -21.5% AH after setting guidance, suspending dividend

    • Citing plunging oil prices and their impact on industry capex, Civeo (NYSE:CVEO) expects Q1 revenue of $160M-$175M (below a $228M consensus), and 2015 revenue of $540M-$600M (below an $817.2M consensus). Q1 and 2015 adjusted EBITDA guidance is respectively at $45M-$55M and $135M-$160M.
    • The company is suspending its quarterly dividend (previously $0.13/share), and says it "has reduced headcount in its Canadian and U.S. operations by 30% and 45%, respectively, from levels at the beginning of 2014."
    • Management is "actively seeking short term accommodations agreements to augment contracted room revenue and maintain market share and providing certain services to third parties for a fee."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 9 Comments
  • XGTI

    xG Technology now -35.1%; Feltl worried about backlog, dilution

    • xG Technology (NASDAQ:XGTI) has cratered in the wake of Feltl's downgrade to Sell. Volume (1.29M shares) is over 11x above a 3-month average of 114K.
    • Discussing his downgrade, analyst Jeffrey Schreiner states xG's backlog "could be materially overstated given the fact XGTI has been unable to ship prior backlog." He also declares the company hasn't announced "any new material additions" in a year and a half, and says he's "unsure how new revenue opportunities will emerge."
    • Schreiner adds xG's share count has risen to 25M from just 6M in 2012, and considers further dilution to be "more than likely."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • OIBR.C

    Oi, PT fall hard after Greek vote

    • Debt-laden Oi (OIBR -4.4%) is down sharply after a Greek vote that paves the way for a snap election triggered a flight to safety among European equity and debt investors. Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD -7.4%), whose main asset is a stake in Oi, is down even more.
    • SA author/Oi bull David Gilcher recently noted Oi has two bond issues with a total principal of $854M maturing in 2016, and two more with a principal of $3B maturing in 2022. Oi recently stated it will host a bondholder meeting in which it will asked for debt restrictions to be loosened, in order to gain more M&A flexibility.
    • Oi and PT sold off last week in the wake of Oi's 1:10 reverse split. Both companies are near their 52-week lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 29 Comments
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics continues Astellas-stoked up move

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Cytokinetics (CYTK +7.2%) moves northward again. Shares are up almost 35% since the announcement of its expanded collaboration with Astellas.
    • Previously: Cytokinetics and Astellas expand partnership (Dec. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • CAR

    Avis, Hertz rally amid hedge fund disclosures, pricing enthusiasm

    • Hedge fund Viking Global has disclosed a 5.35M-share (5%) stake in Avis (CAR +2.8%). The news comes six days after another hedge fund, Glenview Capital, disclosed a 5.1% stake.
    • Both Avis and Carl Icahn-backed Hertz (HTZ +3.3%) are rallying. Hertz is up 13% since announcing price hikes on Dec. 23.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 4 Comments

  • Oil prices make new 5-year lows

    • Up in early trading thanks to Libya-related concerns, oil prices have now fallen to their lowest levels since May 2009, as supply glut fears refuse to let up a month after OPEC's stunning decision to keep output unchanged triggered a crash. WTI crude is down $1.43 to $53.30/barrel. Brent crude is down $1.66 to $57.79/barrel.
    • Mizuho's Bob Yawger: "The loss of a couple hundred thousand barrels from Libya will have a minimal impact on the global supply balance ... There’s about 2 million barrels a day of excess production right now, so this will just tighten things a little.”
    • Citi's Tim Evans, echoing a common view: "We’re looking at a significant supply-demand surplus through the first half of 2015."
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, UWTI, USL, DWTI, DNO, SZO, OLO, TWTI, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 26 Comments

  • Treasurys rally as Greek vote spurs flight to safety

    • A Greek vote paving the way for January elections that could bring the anti-bailout Syriza party into power have led risk-averse investors to flock to U.S. Treasurys and German Bunds. The 5-year Treasury yield is down 5 bps to 1.72%; the 10-year by 4 bps to 2.21%; and the 30-year by 4 bps to 2.78%.
    • The Bloomberg U.S. Treasury Bond Index is up 5.7% YTD, its biggest gain since 2011. The performance has been accompanied by a flattened yield curve: Treasuries with maturities greater than 10 years are up 23.4%, while those with maturities of 1-5 years are up only 1.1% as the Fed signals rate hikes will eventually arrive.
    • In spite of the 2014 gains and the yield-dampening impact of recent macro events, forecasters have become increasingly pessimistic about 2015 due to rate hike fears. The Bank of Tokyo's Chris Rupkey: "Next year should be the break-out year finally ... The market is ignoring the rhetoric that Yellen and the FOMC is getting closer and closer to tightening. The market has it wrong.”
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, IEF, TBF, EDV, TMF, PST, TTT, ZROZ, SBND, TLH, IEI, TYO, VGLT, DLBS, DTYS, UST, UBT, TLO, VGIT, TBX, BUNL, GSY, TENZ, SCHR, DTYL, TYD, LBND, ITE, GGOV, DLBL, TYBS, BUNT, DFVL, TBZ, FIVZ, DFVS, TYNS, SYTL
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • CEL

    Cellcom, Partner sell off after Cellcom launches TV service

    • Cellcom (CEL -5.5%) has finally made its anticipated entry into Israel's pay-TV market ... and has priced its offerings aggressively. A basic IPTV/VOD service package goes for NIS99/month ($25/month), and a triple-play package featuring TV, Internet, and unlimited mobile calls for three lines goes for NIS199/month ($51/month).
    • Mobile TV viewing is supported, and content from Sony, Disney, BBC, and Lionsgate (among others) has been obtained for the VOD service. Cellcom's pricing undercuts that of incumbent cable provider HOT and satellite provider YES.
    • Telecom minister Gilad Erdan: "This is real news for competition, and we will see service fees drop by 20-30%. The public wants to consume the content wherever it wants, and at a cheaper price ... I hope that new players will follow Cellcom, and enter the market.”
    • Both Cellcom and rival Partner (PTNR -4.1%) are selling off following the announcement. Each carrier has already been stung by an Israeli mobile price war.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • NBGGY

    Greek banks tumble following vote

    • The National Bank of Greece (NBG -8.8%) has dived towards its 52-week low of $1.76 after politicians failed to elect a president in today's vote, thereby triggering an early-2015 snap election that could potentially bring the anti-bailout Syriza party to power.
    • Over in Frankfurt, Alpha Bank (OTCPK:ALBKF) is down 6.1%, and Eurobank Ergasias (OTCPK:EGFEY) is down 7.3%. The Athens exchange is down 3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • LIVE

    LiveDeal +21.3% following FY14 report

    • LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) has risen to its highest levels since early September after posting market-pleasing FY14 (ended Sep. 30) numbers. 6.6M shares have been traded vs. a 3-month daily average of 388K.
    • Marketplace platform (deals) revenue rose to $5.27M in FY14 from nothing in the prior year. Services revenue (tied to phone directory services) fell 15% to $1.99M.
    • G&A spend rose 37% Y/Y to $5.6M, and sales/marketing spend rose to $894K from just $59K. LiveDeal ended FY14 with $8.1M in cash, $920K in notes payable, and $639K in long-term loans.
    • FY14 results, PR, 10-K
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 6 Comments
  • IPHI

    Inphi up 5.9% on Needham upgrade, top pick call

    • Though downgrading several other chipmakers, Needham's Quinn Bolton has upgraded Inpji (NYSE:IPHI) to Strong Buy, and declared the fast-growing analog chipmaker his top pick going into 2015.
    • Bolton: "While we are turning more cautious on semiconductor stocks entering 2015, we believe IPHI is positioned to outperform its peers given its significant exposure to the rapid growth of 100G optical networking."
    • Shares go for 17x 2015E EPS. The 2015 revenue growth consensus (boosted by the Cortina acquisition) is at 58.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • CLF

    Coal stocks rally in early trading

    • Pummeled this year thanks to slumping coal prices, a general rout in commodities names, and (in some cases) bankruptcy fears, coal stocks are seeing bargain-hunters emerge on a quiet late-December trading day.
    • Gainers: CLF +8.2%. WLT +4.6%. ACI +3.3%. BTU +2.1%. ANR +3.8%.
    • On SA, Equity Watch recently argued more pain is in store for the U.S. coal industry 2015, given the April implementation of MATS regulations, declining thermal coal demand (due to the retiring of coal-fired plants), and an unfavorable global supply/demand balance for metallurgical coal. The author does, however, think rising Asian demand could provide some relief for U.S. firms.
    • ETF: KOL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 12 Comments
  • XENE

    Xenon Pharma continues up move

    • Recent IPO Xenon Pharmaceutics (XENE +15.7%) moves up again in early trading. Shares have more than doubled from the discounted $9 debut price.
    • Previously: Xenon Pharma up modestly in debut (Nov. 5)
    • Previously: Xenon Pharma on deck for IPO (Oct. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • ADXS

    Advaxis up again

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Advaxis (ADXS +19.3%) continues its up move in early trading. Shares have almost tripled since investors started their stampede into cancer immunotherapy stocks.
    • Previously: Advaxis continues cancer immunotherapy-stoked up move (Dec. 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • XGTI

    xG Technology down 8.5% after Feltl downgrade

    • Feltl & Co. has downgraded xG Technology (NASDAQ:XGTI) to Sell, and cut its target all the way to $0.35 from $1.00.
    • xG has made new 52-week lows, and is down 46% YTD. The downgrade comes five days after xG announced director Larry Townes is resigning due to "the demands of other personal commitments."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • NLST

    USPTO partially denies SanDisk petitions for review of Netlist patents

    • Netlist (OTC:NLST +4.5%) states the USPTO has fully denied three SanDisk (SNDK -0.6%) petitions for an inter partes review (IPR) of Netlist patent claims, and partly denied a fourth petition. Petitions have been granted to "review three other Netlist patents that have also been asserted" in Netlist's infringement suit against SanDisk and memory module partner Diablo Technologies.
    • Netlist has alleged SanDisk's ULLtraDIMM DDR3 server flash storage modules, which place flash directly on the memory bus (thereby lowering latency), infringe its patents. Along with its enterprise SSDs and Fusion-io's PCIe server flash cards, ULLtraDIMMs are a core part of SanDisk's efforts to grow its sales within the high-margin data center flash storage market. IBM and Super Micro are among the product's supporters.
    • Netlist is up following the announcement.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • ARTX

    Arotech higher on new orders

    • Arotech (ARTX +4.6%) is on the rise after announcing the receipt of $6.7M in new awards and contract modifications at its Training and Simulation Division.
    • The orders include a $2.6M award for its MILO Use-of-Force training system and $2.3M of funding to continue on-site logistical support for its fielded Virtual Clearance Training Suites.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM | 4 Comments
  • LIVE

    LiveDeal misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE): FY14 EPS of -$0.35 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $7.27M (+209.4% Y/Y) beats by $0.55M.
    • Shares +16.1% PM.
    • 10K
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: LIVE +19%. JOB +10%. MTW +10%. RXDX +7%. ARTX +5%.
    • Losers: NBG -9%. PT-OLD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • RVLT

    Revolution Lighting +2.3% on Fastenal distribution deal

    • Leading industrial/construction supplies seller Fastenal has agreed to sell Revolution Lighting's (NASDAQ:RVLT) LED lighting products through its U.S. stores and distribution centers.
    • Fastenal had 2,647 stores at the end of September.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • SWKS

    Needham downgrades SWKS, RFMD, TQNT, AMBA, CAVM, MXL

    • Needham Quinn Bolton is turning more cautious on chip stocks following a blistering 2014: Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS), RF Micro (RFMD), TriQuint (TQNT), Cavium (CAVM), M/A-COM (NASDAQ:MTSI), and MaxLinear (NYSE:MXL) have been downgraded to Hold, and Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) downgraded to Underperform.
    • Bolton often cites valuation. Regarding Skyworks, he notes shares are "up 161% YTD in 2014, vs. 30.3% for the SOX Index and 15.1% for the NASDAQ Composite, and trading above [Needham's] prior price target of $70, or 14x our CY16E non-GAAP EPS estimate."
    • Likewise, Bolton notes RF Micro and TriQuint, who will be jointly known as Qorvo starting on Jan. 1, have exceeded his respective targets of $16.50 and $27.50 (12x 2016E EPS), and would prefer to see if a buying opportunity emerges in 1H15. Cavium is trading above Needham's $58 target (based on a DCF valuation model).
    • Regarding Ambarella, he cites not only valuation, but also a belief the video processor vendor could underperform in 2015 due to slowing revenue growth, gross margin pressure, and price pressure from top customer GoPro. "A more challenging cable outlook and a push-out in the ramp of its satellite gateway and ODU opportunities" are cited as reasons for downgrading MaxLinear.
    • SWKS -1.2% premarket. RFMD -1.1%. TQNT -1.9%. AMBA -3.5%.
    • Last Friday: Chip industry growth expected to slow following strong 2014
    • Bullish opinions: Brean, Rosenblatt
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 16 Comments
  • JUNO

    Juno set for gap up at the open

    • Recent IPO Juno Therapeutics (NASDAQ:JUNO) is up 8% premarket on moderate volume. Shares have more than doubled from the $24 debut price.
    • Previously: Juno Therapeutics on deck for highly-anticipated IPO (Dec. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM
  • RXDX

    Ignyta neuroblastoma drug candidate tagged an Orphan Drug

    • The FDA designates Ignyta's (NASDAQ:RXDX) lead product candidate, entrectinib, an Orphan Drug for the treatment of neuroblastoma.
    • Among the benefits of Orphan Drug status is a seven-year period of market exclusivity if approved.
    • Shares are up 8% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 AM
